intro: Pseudodictamnus latibracteolatus, commonly known as the broad-bract pseudodictamnus, is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in rocky, well-drained soils. The plant features slender, branched stems and lance-shaped leaves with a distinctive, slightly hairy texture. Its flowers are small and white to pale yellow, arranged in compound umbels, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
